title: Göttinger Miszellen
text:
Göttinger Miszellen (often abbreviated as GM) is a scientific journal published by the <a href="Seminar%20f%C3%BCr%20%C3%84gyptologie%20und%20Koptologie">Seminar für Ägyptologie und Koptologie</a> (<a href="G%C3%B6ttingen">Göttingen</a>, <a href="Germany">Germany</a>) which contains short scholarly articles on <a href="Egyptology">Egyptological</a>, <a href="Coptology">Coptological</a>, and other related subjects.
Founded in 1972, its aim is to publish information about new discoveries and theories as quickly and efficiently as possible, and to be a forum for scholarly discussions on Egyptology. In line with this philosophy, GM is published at least four times a year, and contributors (who may submit articles in <a href="German%20language">German</a>, <a href="English%20language">English</a> or <a href="French%20language">French</a>) are required to submit camera-ready copy, as articles are reproduced photographically rather than being re-typed or loaded from <a href="diskette">diskette</a>. Copy is not edited at all by the publishers and is the <a href="wikt%3Averbatim">verbatim</a> work of each author.
Each issue is approximately 112 pages in length and costs 4.50 <a href="euro">euro</a>s. Back issues are only available from No. 47 (1981) onwards, as all earlier copies are out of print. The journal is identified as .
